project_metadata.description: A synthesized Domain Model for an E-commerce system, derived from multiple bounded context analyses. This model aims to maintain consistency, resolve duplicates, and define clear responsibilities across different business areas.

bounded_contexts.description: Responsible for managing customer profiles, contact information, addresses, and personal preferences such as wishlists. It ensures consistent customer identity across the system.

entities.name: Customer
entities.description: Represents an individual customer with a unique identifier, profile details, multiple addresses, and wishlists. All customer data must be encrypted at rest.

entities.name: Wishlist
entities.description: A personalized collection of product SKUs maintained by a Customer, allowing them to save desired items for future consideration.

value_objects.name: Address
value_objects.description: Represents a specific physical location, used for shipping or billing purposes.

value_objects.name: ProfileInformation
value_objects.description: Encapsulates the core personal details of a Customer.

bounded_contexts.description: Manages the entire lifecycle of a customer order, from initiation to delivery, coordinating with Inventory Management for product availability and Payment Processing for financial transactions. Direct dependencies between Inventory Management and Payment Processing are strictly prohibited, all communication must flow through Order Processing.

entities.name: Order
entities.description: Represents a customer's request to purchase one or more products, identified by a unique order number, including its status, customer reference, shipping address, and payment method.

entities.name: OrderItem
entities.description: A specific line item within an Order, detailing the product (by ID), quantity, and unit price at the time of order.

value_objects.name: OrderStatus
value_objects.description: The current state of an order, following defined transitions: OrderPlaced, Pending, Confirmed, Shipped, Delivered, Cancelled.

value_objects.name: Money
value_objects.description: Represents a monetary value with its associated currency.

value_objects.name: Address
value_objects.description: Represents a specific physical location, used for shipping or billing purposes.

bounded_contexts.description: Manages all product-related information, including unique identifiers (SKUs), descriptions, pricing, stock levels, and categorization. It tracks product availability and triggers events based on stock changes.

entities.name: Product
entities.description: A distinct item available for sale, uniquely identified by its SKU, with detailed information including name, description, price, stock level, and category.

value_objects.name: StockLevel
value_objects.description: Encapsulates the various quantities representing a product's inventory status, including available, reserved, and threshold for reordering.

value_objects.name: Money
value_objects.description: Represents a monetary value with its associated currency.

value_objects.name: Category
value_objects.description: A classification label used to group similar products.

bounded_contexts.description: Handles all financial transactions, including initiating payments, processing successful transactions, managing failures, and processing refunds. It also manages stored payment methods for customers, ensuring PCI-DSS compliance.

entities.name: Payment
entities.description: Represents a unique financial transaction for a specific order and customer, including its amount, status, and the payment method used.

entities.name: PaymentMethod
entities.description: Details about a customer's stored payment instrument, such as credit card tokens, type, and expiry, linked to a Customer.

value_objects.name: Money
value_objects.description: Represents a monetary value with its associated currency.

value_objects.name: PaymentStatus
value_objects.description: The current state of a payment transaction (e.g., Initiated, Completed, Failed).

value_objects.name: PaymentMethodDetails
value_objects.description: Sensitive details of a payment instrument, typically tokenized for security and PCI-DSS compliance.
